oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Address of Gen. John M. Johnson
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Address of Gen. John M. Johnson for dedication of Confederate Memorial Hall on January 19, 1929. Johnson lists the virtues of Robert E. Lee and Thomas J. "Stonewall" Jackson. He also talks about Nathan Bedford Forrest not being educated in military tactics and states that he believes "a military education would have destroyed his initiative." The original is in the collections of the Lincoln County Archives.
